pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [7dbd4ee937](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17905/commits/7dbd4ee93725ac23a5a1cb0b5ef5d4b157342dbf)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +4.51% | `Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.Kaehler` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.Kaehler | 1307 | 1366 | +59 (+4.51%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.Kaehler`|59|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Algebra.FormallySmooth.iff_injective_and_projective`
`+ Algebra.FormallySmooth.iff_injective_and_split`
`+ Algebra.FormallySmooth.iff_split_injection`
`+ Algebra.FormallySmooth.iff_subsingleton_and_projective`
`+ derivationQuotKerSq`
`+ derivationQuotKerSq_mk`
`+ instance : Module.Projective P (Œ©[P‚ÅÑR])`
`+ retractionKerCotangentToTensorEquivSection`
`+ tensorKaehlerQuotKerSqEquiv`
`+ tensorKaehlerQuotKerSqEquiv_symm_tmul_D`
`+ tensorKaehlerQuotKerSqEquiv_tmul_D`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

For the record: I think in this case the `large import` label is not a problem, since
- this is a leaf file
- the import bump is mostly a consequence of the development of this file over multiple PRs.

> Very nice! So do I understand correctly that smooth being local is significantly easier than formally smooth being local, because in the former case Œ©_{S/R} is f.p. and hence https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18131 applies?

Exactly. 

> Did you follow Iversen here?

The main sources are stacks project and Iversen.

> The main sources are stacks project and Iversen.

Could you please then add these to the module docstring? If you have the stacks tag at hand, also a `@[stacks]` would be great.

> Could you please then add these to the module docstring? If you have the stacks tag at hand, also a `@[stacks]` would be great.

I didn't follow the proof in stacks so the auxiliary lemmas don't have stacks equivalents but the final result got a tag.

Thanks!

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by chrisflav.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11642668065/job/32422531041)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11642668065/job/32422530967)
Apart from this, LGTM

Very nice! So do I understand correctly that smooth being local is significantly easier than formally smooth being local, because in the former case `Œ©_{S/R}` is f.p. and hence #18131 applies?

Did you follow Iversen here?
Apart from this, LGTM
Should this one be `private` then?
I was told before to avoid tactic proofs when constructing data. Could you try to avoid it here (and below)?

I think it is only necessary to avoid tactics that rewrites the types of the goal e.g. `rw` or `simp` etc.
I've changed `tensorKaehlerQuotKerSqEquiv` but changing the others would make things a lot more messy.

```suggestion
Given a tower of algebras `S/P/R`, with `I = ker(P ‚Üí S)`,
this is the `R`-derivative `P/I¬≤ ‚Üí S ‚äó[P] Œ©[P‚ÅÑR]` given by `[x] ‚Ü¶ 1 ‚äó D x`.
```

```suggestion
lemma derivationQuotKerSq_mk (x : P) :
    derivationQuotKerSq R P S x = 1 ‚äó‚Çú .D R P x := rfl
```
Is this preferred?

```suggestion
    S ‚äó[P ‚ß∏ (RingHom.ker (algebraMap P S) ^ 2)] Œ©[(P ‚ß∏ (RingHom.ker (algebraMap P S) ^ 2))‚ÅÑR] ‚âÉ‚Çó[S]
      S ‚äó[P] Œ©[P‚ÅÑR] := by
```

```suggestion
noncomputable
def retractionKerCotangentToTensorEquivSection :
    { l // l ‚àò‚Çó (kerCotangentToTensor R P S) = LinearMap.id } ‚âÉ
      { g // (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R P S).kerSquareLift.comp g = AlgHom.id R S } := by
```

```suggestion
Given a formally smooth `R`-algebra `P` and a surjective algebra homomorphism `f : P ‚Üí‚Çê[R] S`
with kernel `I` (typically a presentation `R[X] ‚Üí S`),
`S` is formally smooth iff the `P`-linear map `I/I¬≤ ‚Üí S ‚äó[P] Œ©[P‚ÅÑR]` is split injective.
```

```suggestion
include hf in
/--
Given a formally smooth `R`-algebra `P` and a surjective algebra homomorphism `f : P ‚Üí‚Çê[R] S`
with kernel `I` (typically a presentation `R[X] ‚Üí S`),
then `S` is formally smooth iff `I/I¬≤ ‚Üí S ‚äó[P] Œ©[S‚ÅÑR]` is injective and
`S ‚äó[P] Œ©[P‚ÅÑR] ‚Üí Œ©[S‚ÅÑR]` is split injective.
-/
theorem Algebra.FormallySmooth.iff_injective_and_split :
```
I find these maps hard to visualize from the name only, hence more docstrings help.

```suggestion
then `S` is formally smooth iff `I/I¬≤ ‚Üí S ‚äó[P] Œ©[P‚ÅÑR]` is injective and `Œ©[S/R]` is projective.
```

```suggestion
  let e‚ÇÅ : (RingHom.ker (algebraMap P S)).Cotangent ‚âÉ‚Çó[P] (RingHom.ker (algebraMap P' S)) :=
    (Ideal.cotangentEquivIdeal _).trans ((LinearEquiv.ofEq _ _
      (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R P S).ker_kerSquareLift.symm).restrictScalars P)
```
Remember to update also these after updating below.

```suggestion
```
This import is needed for the stacks tag. I added a noshake entry.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Smooth): formally smooth iff `H¬π(L_{R/S}) = 0` and `Œ©_{S/R}` is projective
